result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam J Laughlin

defendant.name: Laughlin, Adam J
defendant.address: N5803 Us Highway 45, New London, WI 54961

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam J Laughlin in court with attorney Jeffrey John Siewert. 
Brenda S Freeman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
15CM250 - defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. 
Court accepts plea and finds guilty of Count 1. 
Count 2 dismissed. 
15CM228 - dismissed and read in. 
Court sentences defendant to 10 days jail, running consecutive with jail sentence in 15CT91. 
Court further orders $150 fine plus costs, due in 60 days.

Assistant District Attorney James Fassbender: Present
  Defendant: Present
  Attorney  Jeffrey Siewert:  Present
  Complaint received.  Waive reading of complaint.
  Plea Not Guilty  Bond continued.
STC to be scheduled by BR2

ADA Veronica Isherwood, Present
Defendant present, in custody
Complaint received.  Waive reading of complaint.
Def will need to re-apply to SPD to have atty appointed on this case.
  Signature Bond $1000
Be in compliance with all bond conditions in 15CT91 ($2,000.00 cash or $2,000.00 signature w/Soberlink):
  Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.  
  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV.  
  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his/her system.  
  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.
  Defendant shall abstain from alcohol consumption and comply with the SoberLink Alcohol monitoring program, Signature Bond only.
